document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FBEBB360DFE30131966268A86D17958E.description: Describe objects designed by artists (e.g., furniture, appliances, cars) that are used at home and at school.

FBEB26B0DFE30131966068A86D17958E.description: Identify and sort pictures into categories according to the elements of art emphasized in the works (e.g., color, line, shape/form, texture).

FBEA8F40DFE30131965E68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast objects of folk art from various time periods and cultures.

FBEA4410DFE30131965D68A86D17958E.description: Clap out rhythmic patterns found in the lyrics of music and use symbols to create visual representations of the patterns.

FBE9AA30DFE30131965B68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FBE964D0DFE30131965A68A86D17958E.description: Select something they like about their work of art and something they would change.

FBE91E70DFE30131965968A86D17958E.description: Describe how and why they made a selected work of art, focusing on the media and technique.

FBE889C0DFE30131965768A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe various reasons for making art.

FBE83660DFE30131965668A86D17958E.description: Discuss works of art created in the classroom, focusing on selected elements of art (e.g., shape/form, texture, line, color).

FBE78740DFE30131965468A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FBE73490DFE30131965368A86D17958E.description: Identify art objects from various cultures (e.g., Japanese screen painting, Mexican tin art, African masks) and describe what they have in common and how they differ.

FBE6E190DFE30131965268A86D17958E.description: View and then describe art from various cultures.

FBE64100DFE30131965068A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe various subject matter in art (e.g., landscapes, seascapes, portraits, still life).

FBE5F940DFE30131964F68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and discuss the design of everyday objects from various time periods and cultures.

FBE5AEE0DFE30131964E68A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FBE55E90DFE30131964D68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FBE4F0A0DFE30131964C68A86D17958E.description: Create artwork based on observations of actual objects and everyday scenes.

FBE495B0DFE30131964B68A86D17958E.description: Use visual and actual texture in original works of art.

FBE44960DFE30131964A68A86D17958E.description: Draw or paint a still life, using secondary colors.

FBE3FCE0DFE30131964968A86D17958E.description: Create a representational sculpture based on people, animals, or buildings.

FBE3B170DFE30131964868A86D17958E.description: Plan and use variations in line, shape/form, color, and texture to communicate ideas or feelings in works of art.

FBE367D0DFE30131964768A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FBE314D0DFE30131964668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate beginning skill in the manipulation and use of sculptural materials (clay, paper, and papier maché) to create form and texture in works of art.

FBE2BA90DFE30131964568A86D17958E.description: Mix secondary colors from primary colors and describe the process.

FBE272A0DFE30131964468A86D17958E.description: Use texture in two-dimensional and three-dimensional works of art.

FBE1E190DFE30131964268A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FBE198B0DFE30131964168A86D17958E.description: Identify the elements of art in objects in nature, in the environment, and in works of art, emphasizing line, color, shape/form, and texture.

FBE14AB0DFE30131964068A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FBE0ED30DFE30131963F68A86D17958E.description: Distinguish among various media when looking at works of art (e.g., clay, paints, draw-ing materials).

FBE0A2C0DFE30131963E68A86D17958E.description: Describe and replicate repeated patterns in nature, in the environment, and in works of art.

FBE05450DFE30131963D68A86D17958E.description: Develop Perceptual Skills and Visual Arts Vocabulary

FBDFDED0DFE30131963C68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FBDF0570DFE30131963A68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to work cooperatively in presenting a tableau, an improvisation, or a pantomime.

FBDE6700DFE30131963868A86D17958E.description: Apply the theatrical concept of beginning, middle, and end to other content areas. For example, act out the life cycle of a butterfly.

FBDDD3B0DFE30131963668A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FBDD8530DFE30131963568A86D17958E.description: Identify and discuss emotional reactions to a theatrical experience.

FBDD2E40DFE30131963468A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FBDCE9D0DFE30131963368A86D17958E.description: Describe what was liked about a theatrical work or a story.

FBDC5D10DFE30131963168A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FBDC1790DFE30131963068A86D17958E.description: Describe the roles and responsibilities of audience and actor.

FBDBCAE0DFE30131962F68A86D17958E.description: Identify theatrical conventions, such as props, costumes, masks, and sets.

FBDB2560DFE30131962D68A86D17958E.description: Identify the cultural and geographic origins of stories.

FBDAD600DFE30131962C68A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FBDA7DF0DFE30131962B68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FBDA32A0DFE30131962A68A86D17958E.description: Dramatize or improvise familiar simple stories from classroom literature or life experi-ences, incorporating plot (beginning, middle, and end) and using a tableau or a panto-mime.

FBD98A10DFE30131962868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate skills in pantomime, tableau, and improvisation.

FBD8FC90DFE30131962668A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FBD8B6E0DFE30131962568A86D17958E.description: Observe and describe the traits of a character.

FBD86B80DFE30131962468A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FBD81680DFE30131962368A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of the theatre, such as play, plot (beginning, middle, and end), improvisa-tion, pantomime, stage, character, and audience, to describe theatrical experiences.

FBD7D2A0DFE30131962268A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FBD78E90DFE30131962168A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FBD70630DFE30131961F68A86D17958E.description: Describe how the performance of songs and dances improves after practice and re-hearsal.

FBD671F0DFE30131961D68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and explain how people respond to their world through music.

FBD5CC90DFE30131961B68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FBD57CE0DFE30131961A68A86D17958E.description: Describe how ideas or moods are communicated through music.

FBD530F0DFE30131961968A86D17958E.description: Create movements to music that reflect focused listening.

FBD4A100DFE30131961768A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FBD44AE0DFE30131961668A86D17958E.description: Recognize and talk about music and celebrations of the cultures represented in the school population.

FBD3B220DFE30131961468A86D17958E.description: Use developmentally appropriate movements in responding to music from various genres, periods, and styles (rhythm, melody, form).

FBD36C20DFE30131961368A86D17958E.description: Use a personal vocabulary to describe voices, instruments, and music from diverse cultures.

FBD324B0DFE30131961268A86D17958E.description: Sing and play simple singing games from various cultures.

FBD28000DFE30131961068A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FBD23C70DFE30131960F68A86D17958E.description: Improvise simple rhythmic accompaniments, using body percussion or classroom instruments.

FBD1B300DFE30131960D68A86D17958E.description: Play simple accompaniments on classroom instruments.

FBD11DF0DFE30131960B68A86D17958E.description: Sing with accuracy in a developmentally appropriate range.

FBD05700DFE30131960968A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FBD00820DFE30131960868A86D17958E.description: Identify common instruments visually and aurally in a variety of music.

FBCFC500DFE30131960768A86D17958E.description: Identify simple musical forms (e.g., phrase, AB, echo).

FBCF7E10DFE30131960668A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FBCF3140DFE30131960568A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform simple patterns of rhythm and pitch, using beat, rest, and divided beat (two sounds on one beat).

FBCE8F40DFE30131960368A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FBCDE810DFE30131960168A86D17958E.description: Give examples of how dance relates to other subjects (e.g., mathematics—shape, count-ing; language arts—beginning, middle, and end).

FBCD94E0DFE30131960068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate curricular concepts through dance (e.g., growth cycle, animal movement).

FBCD0BE0DFE3013195FE68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FBCCC6E0DFE3013195FD68A86D17958E.description: Describe how they communicate an idea or a mood in a dance (e.g., with exaggerated everyday gesture or emotional energies).

FBCC82B0DFE3013195FC68A86D17958E.description: Describe the experience of dancing two different dances (e.g., Seven Jumps, La Raspa).

FBCBE510DFE3013195FA68A86D17958E.description: Use basic dance vocabulary to identify and describe a dance observed or performed (e.g., shapes, levels, directions, tempo/fast-slow).

FBCB89B0DFE3013195F968A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FBCB3770DFE3013195F868A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FBCAF3D0DFE3013195F768A86D17958E.description: Identify where and when people dance.

FBCA6B80DFE3013195F568A86D17958E.description: List commonalities among basic locomotor movements in dances from various countries.

FBCA1F50DFE3013195F468A86D17958E.description: Describe aspects of the style, costumes, and music of a dance.

FBC9CEC0DFE3013195F368A86D17958E.description: Name and perform folk/traditional dances from other countries.

FBC93310DFE3013195F168A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FBC8DC60DFE3013195F068A86D17958E.description: Work with others in a group to solve a specific dance problem (e.g., design three shapes—high, medium, and low; create slow and fast movements).

FBC86B30DFE3013195EF68A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FBC818D0DFE3013195EE68A86D17958E.description: Perform improvised movement ideas for peers.

FBC7D700DFE3013195ED68A86D17958E.description: Express basic emotional qualities (e.g., angry, sad, excited, happy) through movement.

FBC70F70DFE3013195EA68A86D17958E.description: Create shapes and movements at low, middle, and high levels.

FBC6C660DFE3013195E968A86D17958E.description: Create a short movement sequence with a beginning, a middle, and an end.

FBC673A0DFE3013195E868A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FBC63160DFE3013195E768A86D17958E.description: Respond in movement to a wide range of stimuli (e.g., music, books, pictures, rhymes, fabrics, props).

FBC5EF10DFE3013195E668A86D17958E.description: Use improvisation to discover movements in response to a specific movement problem (e.g., find a variety of ways to walk; create five types of circular movement).

FBC569E0DFE3013195E468A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FBC524D0DFE3013195E368A86D17958E.description: Name basic locomotor and axial movements (e.g., skip, slide, stretch, roll).

FBC486F0DFE3013195E168A86D17958E.description: Perform short movement problems, emphasizing the element of space (e.g., shapes/lines, big/small, high/low).

FBC44300DFE3013195E068A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FBC3FD10DFE3013195DF68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to vary control and direct force/energy used in basic locomotor and axial movements (e.g., skip lightly, turn strongly, fall heavily).

FBC3B930DFE3013195DE68A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FBC36FB0DFE3013195DD68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception – Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
